name: Bird Dog
setup: Start in tabletop position (hands and knees)
Hands directly under shoulders, knees under hips
Spine neutral, core braced, head in line with spine
Distribute weight evenly across all four points
steps: Simultaneously extend opposite arm and leg (e.g., right arm, left leg)
Reach arm forward and leg back, forming straight line from hand to foot
Hold position briefly (1-3s) while maintaining neutral spine
Return arm and leg to start position with control
cues: Form straight line from hand to foot
mistakes: Arching or sagging through lower back
Rotating hips or shoulders (losing neutral spine)
Rushing the movement or losing balance
Hyperextending neck (looking up instead of down)
Not fully extending arm or leg
safety: If lower back feels strained, reduce range or regress to single-arm or single-leg variations. Great for core stability and low back health.

regressions: Bird dog hold (static hold, no alternating)
progressions: Weighted bird dog (ankle weight or light dumbbell)
Bird dog row (add dumbbell row with extended arm)

prescriptionHints.load: Bodyweight (can add ankle weights or light DB)
prescriptionHints.notes: Foundational core stability exercise. Focus on quality and control over reps.

joints.notes: Maintain neutral spine throughout. Avoid arching or rotating. Use mat or pad under knees if uncomfortable.
